results.title: Pathways
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, video, projections, text, audio, bespoke screens, tiered  wooden seating , timber and LED strips
results.brief_description:
A collaboration between artist-filmmaker Jeff Doring and the Ngarinyin Aboriginal Corporation. This spatial installation provides access and insight into the art and culture of the Ngarinyin people. The intention is to record and interpret a broad spectrum of Ngarinyin knowledge and law. The work consists of five discrete and interrelated elements:
1. The Introduction zone: a space consisting of a text, audio, visual introduction to the installation.
2. The Water and Wanjina zone: a corridor with apertures that open on the side to reveal visual works.
3. The Man Blood Law zone: a three screen installation with tiered seating that lies at the end of the Water and Wanjina corridor.
4. The Cave zone: an exhibition space which spatially represents a cave with images projected inside it.
5. The Today zone: a space which provides a contemporary perspective on the exhibition via a web installation.

results.title: Street kids
results.creator_credit: Rob Scott, Leigh Tilson, Kent Chadwick, Film Victoria and York St Film Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary about homeless youths, some as young as 10, surviving by any means on the streets of Melbourne. Various young people are interviewed about their situation and their search for jobs and accommodation. Highlights the frustrations they face and the resultant temptation to fall into crime and prostitution in order to survive. Police and social workers who deal with these young people from day to day comment on the situation and how they attempt to alleviate the despair of those they encounter. Use of voice-overs (street kids talking about their lives) is very effective as well as disturbing. A courageous and compelling documentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob Scott, Leigh Tilson, Kent Chadwick, Film Victoria and York St Film Productions

results.title: Cricket Coaching Clinic
results.brief_description: A program in which international cricketers demonstrate the essential skills of the game. “The Cricket Coaching Clinic” is designed to instruct and motivate young and old, the uninitiated and the experienced.
results.description: A program in which international cricketers demonstrate the essential skills of the game. “The Cricket Coaching Clinic” is designed to instruct and motivate young and old, the uninitiated and the experienced.

results.title: Indian cooking, Parsi style
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look ‘n’ Cook”.
The Parsi community originated 1,353 years ago, when a small group of people migrated from ancient Persia to India. Today there are hardly 100,000 members of this community in existence. The secrets of their culinary art - the ingredients and style of their cooking - are revealed in this program.

results.title: An Inner passion
results.creator_credit: Hung Lin and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Hand-drawn 2-D animated moral tale of a baker and his assistant and how one person’s passion can inspire and change the actions of their bullying and intolerant boss.
Original music score by James Hodson. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Carnaval
results.creator_credit: Juan Serrano and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A computer animated story of myth, magic and power and two alien beings spirited away to planet Earth. No dialogue. Original music score by SISMO.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: New love
results.creator_credit: Jayt Buchanan and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A captivating piece of animation about the wonderment of new love - the hopes and dreams and the possibilities. Dialogue is replaced by the simple flowing of words as they weave in and out and around the lovers. Music score adapted from the track New Love by Cam Butler and Silver Ray.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jayt Buchanan and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Under the influence
results.creator_credit: Fletcher Cheng and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
One wrong decision and your life can turn into hell. An intriguing computer animated moral tale of alcohol and addiction with a great soundtrack - music by Fletcher Cheng. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.

results.title: Skyfall
results.creator_credit: Robby Susanto, Lu Gao and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Great collaboration between a 2D and 3D animator to create a composite of cutout animation styles. A series of landscapes are degraded by human activities, in a dreamlike meditation on the despoilment of nature.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
